edu.uci.calismall

Class BubbleMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.ScaleGestureDetector.SimpleOnScaleGestureListener
      • edu.uci.calismall.GenericTouchHandler
        • edu.uci.calismall.BubbleMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener, TouchHandler

    public class BubbleMenu
extends GenericTouchHandler
    A pop-up menu shown when the user "closes" a path creating a scrap selection.
    Author:
    Michele Bonazza

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BubbleMenu.Button
      A clickable button in the bubble menu.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float BUTTON_SIZE_TO_SCREEN_WIDTH_RATIO
      The ratio used to make buttons have the same physical size regardless of the actual pixel density of the device.

    • Method Detail

      • onTouch

        boolean onTouch(int action,
              PointF touchPoint,
              Scrap selection)
        Calls touched() on the listener set for the button that contains touchPoint if any does and returns whether the bubble menu should keep being displayed.

        If touchPoint is outside this method does nothing and returns false.

        Parameters:
        action - the kind of action that was performed by the user when touching the canvas
        touchPoint - the point that was touched by the user
        selection - the current selected scrap
        Returns:
        whether the bubble menu should still be displayed on the argument selection after this method returns

      • buttonTouched

        boolean buttonTouched(PointF touchPoint,
                    Scrap selection)
        Tests whether the argument point is within any of the buttons on this menu.
        Parameters:
        touchPoint - the point to be tested
        selection - the current selection
        Returns:
        true if touchPoint is within any of the buttons

      • onDown

        public boolean onDown(PointF touchPoint)
        Description copied from interface: TouchHandler
        Called when an MotionEvent.ACTION_DOWN is detected, that is whenever the first touch event is detected for an action.
        Specified by:
        onDown in interface TouchHandler
        Overrides:
        onDown in class GenericTouchHandler
        Parameters:
        touchPoint - the point in canvas coordinates touched by the user
        Returns:
        true if the event should be "swallowed" by this method, false if it should be forwarded to other TouchHandler'

      • setBounds

        void setBounds(Path selectionPath,
             float scaleFactor,
             RectF bounds)
        Updates the position of buttons in this menu according to the argument selectionPath and current scaleFactor applied to the canvas.
        Parameters:
        selectionPath - the path drawn by the user to select elements in the canvas
        scaleFactor - the current (cumulative) scale factor applied to the canvas
        bounds - the portion of the canvas currently displayed

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(float scaleFactor,
             RectF bounds)
        Updates the display bounds for bubble menus.
        Parameters:
        scaleFactor - the current (cumulative) scale factor applied to the canvas
        bounds - the portion of the canvas currently displayed
